content.question:
<math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of saturated <math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> solution
 Concentration of <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ions
 Absorbance

7.50
 <math alttext="3.2 times 10 to the negative 8 power molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
 0.047

7.25
 <math alttext="5.6 times 10 to the negative 8 power molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
 0.149

7.00
 <math alttext="1.0 time 10 to the negative 7 power molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
 0.470

<math alttext="C u with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> absorbs a certain frequency of visible light. Absorbance was measured at this frequency for three saturated solutions of <math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, each at a different <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="298 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the data recorded in the table above, which of the following conclusions about the effect of <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on the solubility of <math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> can be made?

choices.label: When the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is decreased, the solubility of <math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> increases.

When the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is increased, the solubility of <math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> increases.

The solubility of <math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is independent of <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is soluble only at a <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of 7.00.

content.answer: When the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is decreased, the solubility of <math alttext="C u, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> increases.

skill.text: 2.D: Make observations or collect data from representations of laboratory setups or results, while attending to precision where appropriate.
